required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate the Efficacy and Feasibility of Modified Reduce-volume Target IMRT in the Treatment of Patients With Non-metastatic NPC
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Real-world Study in Patients With Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma: to Evaluate the Efficacy and Feasibility of Modified Reduce-volume Target IMRT in the Treatment of Patients With Non-metastatic NPC

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective real-world study to evaluate the efficacy and feasibility of modified reduce-volume target IMRT in the treatment of patients with non-metastatic NPC

primary_outcome.description: The duration of time to LFFS was calculated from the date of histological diagnosis until documented treatment local failure.

arm_group.description: Patients with newly diagnosed, non-metastatic NPC was given modified reduce-volume target IMRT

intervention.description: The gross tumor volume of the nasopharynx and neck nodes (GTVnx and GTVnd) were delineated according to the tumor extension. The CTVnx was defined as GTVnx + nasopharynx mucosa + 8mm +corresponding anatomical structure without the delineation of CTV1. The CTVnd was defined as GTVnd plus the elective neck area. The prescribe doses of GTVnx/GTVnd, CTVnx, CTVnd were 66-70Gy,54-56Gy and 50-54Gy in 31-35 fractions, respectively.

study_pop.textblock: Non-metastatic NPC patients treated with modified reduce-volume target IMRT in our institution

facility.name: Department of radiation oncology, Fujian cancer hospital
